definition: a humorous drawing in a newspaper or magazine, especially one about politics or events in the news
a series of drawings inside boxes that tell a story and are often printed in newspapers
a film or TV show made by photographing a series of gradually changing drawings or models, so that they look as if they are moving
a drawing made by an artist as a preparation for a painting
a large tropical snake that kills animals for food by winding its long body tightly around them
criminal activities that involve sex or drugs
behaviour that is evil or immoral; a quality in somebody’s character that is evil or immoral
a tool with two metal blocks that can be moved together by turning a screw. The vice is used to hold an object in place while work is done on it.
a person who takes part in a public meeting or march (= an organized walk by many people) in order to protest against somebody/something or to show support for somebody/something
a person whose job is to show or explain how something works or is done
with a range of notes one octave below that of a bass instrument
